metadata.Title: CVE-2010-4657 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible
metadata.Description:
PHP5 before 5.4.4 allows passing invalid utf-8 strings via thexmlTextWriterWriteAttribute, which are then misparsed by libxml2. Thisresults in memory leak into the resulting output.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-4657` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
libphp5-embed - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php-pear - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5 - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-cgi - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-cli - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-common - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-curl - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-enchant - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-fpm - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-gd - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-gmp - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-intl - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-ldap - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-mysql - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-mysqlnd - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-odbc - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-pgsql - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-pspell - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-readline - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-recode - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-snmp - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-sqlite - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-sybase - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-tidy - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-xmlrpc - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
php5-xsl - 5.4.9-4ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.9-4ubuntu1').
